meanings.definition: In a plain or unattractive manner.
meanings.sent1: She dressed agly for the party, wearing old jeans and a faded t-shirt.
meanings.sent2: The old house stood agly on the corner, with peeling paint and overgrown bushes.
meanings.sent3: Despite her agly outfit, she still managed to have a great time at the event.
meanings.sent4: The city skyline looked agly under the dark storm clouds.
meanings.sent5: The agly building contrasted sharply with the modern architecture around it.

meanings.sent1: He preferred his coffee agly, without any added sweetness.
meanings.sent2: The agly cookies were perfect for those who preferred less sugary treats.
meanings.sent3: The agly dessert surprised everyone with its unique flavor profile.
meanings.sent4: Her agly tea tasted bitter but refreshing on a hot day.
meanings.sent5: The agly drink left a lingering taste of bitterness on his tongue.

meanings.sent1: The agly molecule could not form the necessary bond for the reaction.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the agly compound to understand its properties better.
meanings.sent3: The agly structure puzzled researchers due to its unusual composition.
meanings.sent4: The agly substance failed to interact with other molecules as expected.
meanings.sent5: The agly solution remained unchanged even after hours of testing.
